div.head: Encoding
div.p: All of our documents are encoded using a small subset of the Text Encoding Initiative P5 schema.

div.head: Processing
div.p: All of our processing relies on open-source and open-access technologies. We follow the Endings Principles for Digital Longevity, and thus all of our pages are built statically, which means that there is no dependence on server side processing.
All of our processing and source code is open-source and available through our Github repository.

div.head: Search
div.p: The search functionality is a prototype, which stems from ongoing work by Martin Holmes and Joey Takeda. This is a fully functional, Javascript-only search engine, built using pre-built indexes of all of the documents. We use the Porter Stemmer (1980) algorithm for word stemming; our indexes are created via a custom XSLT (which can be found on Github).

div.head: Documentation
div.p: All of the encoding documentation for the WEA can be found here for those interested in our current encoding practices and protocols.
